You are given a list of $n$ house locations along a road, represented by the integers $x_1, x_2, ..., x_n$.  A cellular company wants to place three base stations along the road to provide coverage to all houses. Each base station has a power $d$ and provides coverage to all houses within a distance of $d$ units in either direction from its location.

Find the minimum power $d$ required to cover all houses. Also, provide three possible locations for the base stations. 

The locations of the base stations can be any integer between 0 and $2 \cdot 10^9$, inclusive.  It is acceptable for two or more base stations to be located at the same point.

You are given a list of house locations along a line. You need to place three base stations of equal range along the line so that all houses are covered.  Find the smallest possible range for the base stations and give three possible locations for them.
